name: Fort Canning Park
description: A historical hilltop landmark and nature reserve located in the heart of the Civic District. Serves as an important green lung for the city, and a popular venue for a myriad of outdoor events.
address: Singapore 179618, Fort Canning Park is bounded by Hill Street, Canning Rise, Clemenceau Avenue, and River Valley Road

name: National Kitchen by Violet Oon Singapore
description: Widely recognised as an authority on Peranakan cuisine, Violet Oon's prolific background as a chef, restaurateur, and food writer culminates in this distinctive luxurious dining hall—a modern celebration of authentic local flavours.
address: 1 St. Andrew's Road, #02-01 National Gallery Singapore (City Hall Wing), Singapore 178957
opening hours: LUNCH 12pm-2:30pm daily TEA 3pm-5pm daily DINNER 6pm-10:30pm daily

name: Timbre X @ The Arts House
description: An intimate bar nestled in a gazetted national monument along the Singapore River—perfect for drinks, pizza, pasta, and tapas with a city-spangled view. Holds nightly musical performances.

name: Asian Civilisations Museum
description: A heritage museum dedicated to studying the rich cultural diversity and historical connections within Asia, and between Asia and the world

name: Long Bar (AT RAFFLES HOTEL)
description: The birthplace of the original Singapore Sling cocktail, housed within Singapore's oldest, most distinguished hotel.

name: MINT Museum of Toys
description: The first and only museum in the world dedicated to the showcase of vintage toys and childhood memorabilia from the mid-19th to mid-20th Century

name: Lau Pa Sat
description: An iconic hawker centre ('Old Market') for all local cuisine cravings, known as one of the oldest Victorian design structures in Southeast Asia. A prime example of colonial architecture built in the 19th century

name: Satay Street (AT LAU PA SAT)
description: An al fresco dining area that comes to life as Boon Tat Street closes every evening, serving up a spread of local satay (grilled meat on skewers served with peanut sauce). Reminiscent of Singapore's street food culture in the 1950s
opening hours: LAU PA SAT 24 hours daily SATAY STREET 7pm-late daily

name: Chinatown Food Street
description: An al fresco dining area in the heart of Chinatown serving up local favourites like char kway teow and oyster omelette, along with a diverse spread from other culturesin Singapore.

name: Haji Lane
description: Singapore's original indie neighbourhood lined with independent fashion boutiques, Middle Eastern cafes, and clubs. Doubles as an Instagram haven, adorned with street art and vibrant colours

name: Red Dot Design Museum
description: A boutique museum featuring the world's largest exhibition of contemporary product and communication design. All exhibits are winners of the international Red Dot Design Award—one of the world's leading design competitions.

name: Gardens by the Bay
description: Singapore's premier horticultural attraction and icon, showcasing garden artistry through looming Supertrees of over 700 plant species, along with three public gardens ranging from temperate grasslands to tropical forests—sprawled over 250 acres of land
opening hours: OCBC SKYWAY 9am-9pm daily OUTDOOR GARDENS 5am-2am daily COOLED CONSERVATORIES 9am-9pm daily

name: Tea Bone Zen Mind
description: A specialty tea house located within two 20th century shophouses, featuring a blend of Art Deco and Chinese Baroque architectural styles. Deals in fine quality Chinese, Japanese, and English teas—along with artisanal teaware.
opening hours: Mon-Sat: 11am-7pm Closed on Sundays & Public Holidays
